intro: Psychotria sohmeriana, commonly known as the Sohmer's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are dispersed by birds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
